title: Shannon and Entropy
desc: Recently, I was introduced to the idea of information entropy. With the popularity of WORDLE with my friends and the 3blue1brown video, here is a text recommended by my Data Science Lab Professor. Focus on page 1-19.

title: References for Computer Architecture
desc: I took 'Computer Architecture' with Yale Patt and I remember having trouble finding written references. Here some from UC Berkeley, I hope they still work.

title: Good Linear Algebra Read
desc: I've always found linear algebra as one of the harder subjects to comprehend â€” beyond solving problems in a math class. This book was recommended by my Computer Vision professor, and I think it is a good starting point for anyone who wants to learn.

title: Stanford Compilers
desc: I've always wanted to take a compilers class, but unfortunately the University of Texas at Austin does not offer any compilers course for an undergraduate ECE student. Fortunately, Stanford offers a free web course for anyone who wants to learn.
